articles.headline: Medical Debt Collector to Settle Suit for $2.5 Million
articles.snippet: Accretive Health settled accusations by the Minnesota state attorney general’s office that it violated a federal law requiring hospitals to provide emergency care, even if patients cannot afford to pay.
articles.abstract: Accretive Health settled accusations by the Minnesota state attorney general’s office that it violated a federal law requiring hospitals to provide emergency care, even if patients cannot afford to pay.
articles.lead_paragraph: Accretive Health, one of the nation’s largest collectors of medical debt, has agreed to pay $2.5 million to the Minnesota state attorney general’s office to settle accusations that it violated a federal law requiring hospitals to provide emergency care, even if patients cannot afford to pay.

articles.headline: New Boldness From Militants Poses Risk to U.S.-Pakistan Ties
articles.snippet: The Haqqanis’ pursuit of mass American casualties, combined with simmering political tension, has reduced room for ambiguity between Pakistan and the United States.
articles.abstract: The Haqqanis’ pursuit of mass American casualties, combined with simmering political tension, has reduced room for ambiguity between Pakistan and the United States.
articles.lead_paragraph: ISLAMABAD, Pakistan — Grinning for the camera, the suicide bomber fondly patted his truckload of explosives. “We will defeat these crusader pigs as they have invaded our land,” he declared as he revved the engine.
articles.byline: By Declan Walsh and Eric Schmitt

articles.headline: Social Media Are Giving a Voice to Taste Buds
articles.snippet: Some companies are leaning on social media like Facebook, Twitter and Foursquare for advice on what products to bring to market.
articles.abstract: Some companies are leaning on social media like Facebook, Twitter and Foursquare for advice on what products to bring to market.
articles.lead_paragraph: Frito-Lay is developing a new potato chip flavor, which, in the old days, would have involved a series of focus groups, research and trend analysis.

articles.headline: Some at Fed Are Urging Pre-emptive Stimulus
articles.snippet: On the eve of the Fed’s policy-making committee meeting, members who favor more stimulus argued that the likely path of the economy was enough reason for action.
articles.abstract: On the eve of the Fed’s policy-making committee meeting, members who favor more stimulus argued that the likely path of the economy was enough reason for action.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — Some Federal Reserve officials are reviving an idea that rose and fell with Alan Greenspan, the former Fed chairman, as they seek to persuade colleagues to take new action to stimulate growth.

articles.headline: Muni Rates Examined for Signs of Rigging
articles.snippet: In the wake of the scandal over the manipulation of Libor, the $3 trillion municipal bond market is looking at the company that sets its rates, with little transparency.
articles.abstract: In the wake of the scandal over the manipulation of Libor, the $3 trillion municipal bond market is looking at the company that sets its rates, with little transparency.
articles.lead_paragraph: Yet another key benchmark in the financial industry is under scrutiny.

articles.headline: Caustic Crusader at Center of F.D.A. Scandal
articles.snippet: After Dr. Robert C. Smith accused his supervisors at the Food and Drug Administration of harmful practices, they began a wide-ranging surveillance operation on him.
articles.abstract: After Dr. Robert C. Smith accused his supervisors at the Food and Drug Administration of harmful practices, they began a wide-ranging surveillance operation on him.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — As he often did, Dr. Robert C. Smith was hammering away at his bosses at the Food and Drug Administration in the most caustic of terms at a meeting to address his concerns about the approval of medical devices.
articles.byline: By Eric Lichtblau and Scott Shane

articles.headline: Romney Trip Raises Sparks at a 2nd Stop
articles.snippet: Mitt Romney’s remarks on cultural differences between Israelis and Palestinans drew a pointed rebuke from the Palestinian leadership.
articles.abstract: Mitt Romney’s remarks on cultural differences between Israelis and Palestinans drew a pointed rebuke from the Palestinian leadership.
articles.lead_paragraph: JERUSALEM — Mitt Romney offended Palestinian leaders on Monday by suggesting that cultural differences explain why the Israelis are so much more economically successful than Palestinians, thrusting himself again into a volatile issue while on his high-profile overseas trip.
articles.byline: By Ashley Parker and Richard A. Oppel Jr

articles.headline: 2nd Day of Power Failures Cripples Wide Swath of India
articles.snippet: India suffered the largest electrical blackout in history, over an area encompassing about 10 percent of the world’s population.
articles.abstract: India suffered the largest electrical blackout in history, over an area encompassing about 10 percent of the world’s population.
articles.lead_paragraph: NEW DELHI — It had all the makings of a disaster movie: More than half a billion people without power. Trains motionless on the tracks. Miners trapped underground. Subway lines paralyzed. Traffic snarled in much of the national capital.
articles.byline: By Jim Yardley and Gardiner Harris
